content: Ayn Rand's controversial ideas challenge conventional beliefs about selfishness and altruism. Rand's philosophy asserts that prioritizing one's own interests is necessary and moral, which she calls the philosophy of self-interest. Her ideas contribute to the ongoing debate about balancing individual and collective good. Rand's perspective also highlights the importance of balancing one's own interests with the needs of others without sacrificing one's own well-being. Overall, Rand's ideas continue to influence philosophical and political discussions, particularly regarding individual rights and freedoms.
